direct_answer.text: To determine how many slices each person receives, we start by calculating the total number of slices from all the pizzas. Each pizza has 7293443 slices, so seven pizzas would have \(7 \times 7293443 = 51053601\) slices altogether. With four people to split this equally (\(Henry\), and his three friends), we aim to see how many times 4 goes into 51053601, which means doing \(\frac{51053601}{4}\). This results in 12763400.25 slices per person theoretically. However, as it's impractical to serve half a slice and assuming each person wants whole slices, each would ideally take around 12763400 slices. Considering real-world constraints, someone might agree to slightly less to allow others to benefit fully, emphasizing fair play over perfect mathematical division. It's important also to remember that cooking techniques sometimes involve removing excess dough before baking (trimming edges), reducing the theoretical count marginally
